author: jkesselm
msg: Docs.
Need to do a bit more work to make this fully functional for
both SAX and XNI input. Then we need to think about whether
those changes merge directly into SAX2DTM. Advantage
would be single class and avoiding some call/return and
(potential) polymorphism overhead. Disadvantage is that
the XNI calls would add a significant percentage to the total
size of the class; keeping them factored out improves
readability.

author: jkesselm
msg: Reducing non-essential differences between XNI2DTM and SAX2DTM.

author: jkesselm
msg: Reducing non-essential differences between XNI2DTM and SAX2DTM.
We seem to  want to merge the two, at least for RTF/temporary-tree
purposes; this is a step in that direction, re-enabling some of the SAX
handler APIs.
The really ugly part is that we're probably going to want to pass type
information in via the SAX APIs too. Callback, as in recent Xerces?
Additional field(s) on the Attrs object? Respond to xsi:type attrs?

author: tmiller
msg: fixed bug that was calling an inappropriate compare method when the right side of the comparison was a DOM

author: jkesselm
msg: James Riordan's bug -- Attributes on elements returned from
extensions were not being processed successfully. Turns out
our copying logic had a minor sequencing error.
I don't see anything similar listed in Bugzilla.
